basics.name: Sebastian Rowan
basics.about: I am Ph.D. candidate in civil and environmental engineering researching the impacts of flood events and climate change on people and communities. The goal of my research, is to develop a more comprehensive understanding of the risks posed by floods to enable the development of mitigation efforts that prioritize long-term sustainability and community well-being rather than maximizing financial return on investment.

courses: Dissertation Title: Towards Sustainable Flood Risk Management: Incorporating Uncertainty and Environmental Impacts.

projects.name: sviBuildr
projects.summary: An R package that allows users to download or construct the Social Vulnerability Index as a tidyverse dataframe or as simple features dataframe for spatial analyses.

projects.name: NSI Data QGIS Plugin
projects.summary: A basic plugin for QGIS that downloads data from the National Structures Inventory and adds it to a map.

projects.name: useeio_py
projects.summary: A Python translation of the USEPA's useeior R package for building and using USEEIO models.

volunteer.summary: Volunteer snowboard instructor for Chill Foundation's Boston/Manchester snowboard program, representing the YMCA of Downtown Manchester
